intro: Dvorakia, commonly known as the mountain daisy, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. These plants are native to various regions in the Mediterranean and parts of Europe, often growing in rocky or alpine environments. Dvorakia species typically feature showy yellow or white flowers arranged in composite heads, with narrow, linear leaves. They are generally perennial herbs that thrive in well-drained soils and full sun. The genus is characterized by its ability to adapt to harsh, arid conditions, making it a resilient component of Mediterranean flora.
